Description:
from CGC:

Strain: 	MT150
Species: 	Caenorhabditis elegans
Genotype: 	egl-3(n150) V.
Description: 	Egg laying defective. Somewhat Uncoordinated-tends to coil. Temperature sensitive allele.
Mutagen: 	EMS
Outcrossed: 	x1
Made by: 	Tsung N/Horvitz B

Name: OG497 (hsf-1 transl. reporetr)
Description:
from CGC:

Strain: 	OG497
Species: 	Caenorhabditis elegans
Genotype: 	drSi13 II; unc-119(ed3) III.
Description: 	drSi13 [hsf-1p::hsf-1::GFP::unc-54 3'UTR + Cbr-unc-119(+)] II. hsf-1 cDNA with a C-terminal GFP and controlled by 4 kb of the hsf-1 promoter, integrated at a single copy by MosSCI on chromosome II at ttTi5605 in EG4322. Exhibits nuclear GFP expression that redistributes into granules after >1 min 35C heat shock. Reference: Morton EA, Lamitina T. Aging Cell. 2012 Oct 26. doi: 10.1111/acel.12024.
Mutagen: 	
Outcrossed: 	x
Made by: 	Elizabeth Morton

Name: unc-31(e928)
Description:
unc-31(e928).

This strain is a 10x backcross of CB928. The original CB928 that we had (AZ161) was found to be wt for unc-31 by PCR. DA509 was obtained from the Gruenbaum lab by Shachar, and can be found in the CGC as well.

Name: osm-6::GCamp3/nmChr pha-1
Description:
osm-6::GCaMP3 osm-6::nuclear mCherry pha-1r on pha-1(e2123) background

Expression pattern: many sensory neurons in the Amphid organ and some in the anterior, ventral and retrovesicular ganglia. GCaMP activation in AWA and AWC by DA and IAA demonstrated.

Strong expression and good transmission

2.4 kb osm-6 promoter

Name: mod-1::GCamp3/nmChr pha-1
Description:
mod-1::GCaMP3 mod-1::nuclear mCherry pha-1r on pha-1(e2123) background

Expression pattern: ~7-8 head neurons including AIY and other ventral and lateral cells. AIY dynamics during DA+IAA application demonstrated.

Strong expression and good transmission, but mosaic. Expected expression: AIA/B/Y/Z + others

1.6 kb mod-1 promoter

Name: ser-2b::GCaMP3/nmChr pha-1
Description:
ser-2b::GCaMP3 ser-2b::nuclear mCherry pha-1r on pha-1(e2123) background

Expression pattern: Ventral and lateral ganglia cells, most likely including AIY and supposedly also AIZ

moderate expression level, moderate transmission

2.1 kb ser-2b promoter

Name: odr-1 (n1936)
Description: AWC chemosensory defect. Exact mutation location not verified, consult Shachar

Name: odr-3 (n2150)
Description: Exact mutation location not verified, consult Shachar

Name: odr-4 (n2144)
Description:
defective in DA, TT and BA chemotaxis. Temperature sensitive? 

Exact mutation locations not fully verified, see Dwyer et al., 1998. consult Shachar

Name: odr-5 (ky9)
Description:
uncloned gene, sequence and mutation unknown.

AWC defective, similar defect profile to odr-1 (see Bargmann 1993)

Name: odr-7 (ky4)
Description: AWA chemosensory defect. probably C992T change (Sengupta 1994), consult Shachar

Name: osm-9 (ky10)
Description:
Q172 nonsense mutation (Colbert 1997), consult Shachar

TRP channel required for mechano-, osmo- and ASH and AWA chemo-sensation, and adaptation to AWC sensed volatiles (Colbert 1995, Colbert 1997).

Name: sri-14 (ok2865)
Description:
Required for DA sensation by ASH to mediate high-concentration repelence (Taniguchi 2014).

ok2865 is a 532 kb deletion.

The cosmid clone M01G12 which contains the gene, includes an almost identical duplicate of most of the gene on the opposite strand, just 2kb upstream to the CDS. If this is a true reflection of the genomic structure and not a cloning/sequence erro, this may complicate genotyping of this line.

Name: eri-1 (mg366)
Description:
enhanced RNAi sensitivity in neurons.

mutation is a 23 bp insertion

Name: PY7505
Description: oyIs84 [gpa-4p::TU#813 + gcy-27p::TU#814 + gcy-27p::GFP + unc-122p::dsRed]. TU#813 and TU#814 are split caspase vectors (Chalfie Lab) subcloned downstream of the gpa-4 promoter and gcy-27 promoter, respectively. ASI is ablated in this strain. Increased dauer formation. Expression of dsRed in coelomocytes. Reference: Beverly M, Anbil S, Sengupta P. J Neurosci. 2011 Aug 10;31(32):11718-27.

Name: PY7505
Description: oyIs84 [gpa-4p::TU#813 + gcy-27p::TU#814 + gcy-27p::GFP + unc-122p::dsRed]. TU#813 and TU#814 are split caspase vectors (Chalfie Lab) subcloned downstream of the gpa-4 promoter and gcy-27 promoter, respectively. ASI is ablated in this strain. Increased dauer formation. Expression of dsRed in coelomocytes. Reference: Beverly M, Anbil S, Sengupta P. J Neurosci. 2011 Aug 10;31(32):11718-27.

Name: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::NLS-mCherry-NLS
Description:
osm-6::GC3, osm-6::NLS-mCherry-NLS, X-Ray integration of AZ-240, backcrossed 5 x in N2 background. 
VIABILITY/Fertility: Compared to N2 strain they have only 50.4%(+-8.4 % Stdev) offspring.

Name: CB4856 Hawaiian
Description:
Hawaiian strain
Isolated from a pineapple field in Hawaii in 1972 by L. Hollen. Wild type. Low copy Tc1; pattern IX. C. elegans wild isolate. CB subclone of HA-8 (Tc1 pattern IX). See also WBPaper00005369. [NOTE (4-2014): Users reported abnormalities in CB4856 in late 2013 and early 2014. The current working stock at the CGC was thawed in 2-2014 from stock frozen in 1995.]

Name: str-2::HisCl1::sl2::NLS-mCherry

Name: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS, 10 x backcrossed into N2
Description:
osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS, 10 x backcrossed into N2 X-Ray integration of AZ-240

Fertility: Compared to N2 strain they have only 44%(+-17% Stdev) offspring.  Loss of fertility probably occurs at the later stages of life since a comparison at shorter time span 1-3 days fails to manifest in differences.

Observation: Larval development appears slightly delayed.

Description: goeIs5 [nmr-1p::SL1::GCaMP3.35::SL2::unc-54 3'UTR + unc-119(+)]. Reporter allows visualization of several command interneurons. Reference: Schwarz J & Bringmann H. PLoS One. 2013 Sep 20;8(9):e75853.

Name: glr-1p::glr-1::GFP + lin-15(+)
Description: nuIs25 [glr-1p::glr-1::GFP + lin-15(+)]. Reference: Rango C, et al. Cell. 1998 Sep 18;94(6):751-9.

Name: nmr-1p::G-CaMP3.0 + nmr-1p::DsRed
Description: xuEx1040 [nmr-1p::G-CaMP3.0 + nmr-1p::DsRed]. Pick fluorescent animals to maintain. Reference: Piggott BJ, et al. Cell. 2011 Nov 11;147(4):922-33.

Name: nmr-1(ak4) II.
Description: nmr-1(ak4) II. Fewer spontaneous reversals. Required for NMDA gated currents.

Name: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS, nmr-1p::SL1::GCaMP3.35::SL2::unc-54 3'UTR + unc-119(+)
Description: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS, nmr-1p::SL1::GCaMP3.35::SL2::unc-54 3'UTR + unc-119(+), made by crossing AZ-280 x AZ-319

Name: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS,rab-3p::NLS::GCaMP6s + rab-3p::NLS::tagRFP
Description: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS,rab-3p::NLS::GCaMP6s + rab-3p::NLS::tagRFP, made by crossing AZ-280 and AZ-315. There are no homozygous animals. Double positive animals are most likely heterozygous. Pick double positive animals to maintain. Use RFP filter to pick, double positive animals will have tagRFP nucleus in orange and some nuclei (the amphid neurons) in red.

Name: osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS in unc-31
Description:
osm-6::GC3, osm-6::ceNLS-mCherry-2xSV40NLS (AZ-280) crossed with unc-31 (AZ-179). Worms are supposedly homozygous. They show the unc-31 phenotype. Until 08/08/17 the worms are not yet genotyped by PCR. 

IN CASE OF EXPERIMENTS, PLEASE GENOTYPE THE WORMS!

Name: str-2::gc3,str-2::dsRed, mod-1::nls::mCherry, mod-1::gc3
Description: Cross of the daisy strain (str-2::gc3, str-2::dsRed), with Shachar's AIY strain (mod-1::nls::mCherry, mod-1::gc3).

Name: odr-7(ky4); ceh-36::caspase
Description: Cross of AZ247 (CX4; odr-7, AWA defect) x AZ115 (PY7502; ceh-36p::caspase + srtx-1p::GFP + unc122p::mCherry, AWC ablated).

Name: TJ356; wdr-5.1
Description:
a cross between TJ356 and RB1304 (wdr-5.1 mutant)
verified by PCR

Name: hrde-1 (tm1200)
Description: hrde-1 mutant

Name: nrde-3 (tm1116)
Description: nrde-3 mutant

Name: str-2::dsRed::gc3, mod-1::nls-mCherry:gc3, gpa-6::gc3; pha-1
Description: Triple strain.

Name: odr-7::Chrimson
Description:
Originally:

kyEx5128[gcy28d::GCaMP D381Y coel::dsRed] kyEx5662[odr-7p::Chrimson::SL2::mCherry 5ng/ul,elt-2::mCherry 2 ng/ul, pSM 93 ng/ul]

However, we seperated them, and now we have only:
kyEx5662[odr-7p::Chrimson::SL2::mCherry 5ng/ul,elt-2::mCherry 2 ng/ul, pSM 93 ng/ul]

Name: gcy-28::GCaMP, coel::dsRed
Description:
Originally:

kyEx5128[gcy28d::GCaMP D381Y coel::dsRed] kyEx5662[odr-7p::Chrimson::SL2::mCherry 5ng/ul,elt-2::mCherry 2 ng/ul, pSM 93 ng/ul]

However, we separated them, and now we have only:
kyEx5128[gcy28d::GCaMP D381Y coel::dsRed]

Name: odr-7::Chrimson, gpa-6::GC2.2b (Integrated)
Description:
kyIs587[gpa-6::G-CaMP2.2b 50 ng/ul, coel::dsRed 15ng/ul pSM 35ng/ul. Integrated with UV.
kyEx5662[odr- 7p::Chrimson::SL2::mCherry 5ng/ul, elt-2::mCherry 2 ng/ul, pSM 93 ng/ul]

Name: unc-119p::YFP + unc-119p::sid-1
Description: uIs60[unc-119p::YFP + unc-119p::sid-1]

Name: gcy-28d::HisCl1::SL2::GFP
Description:
CX15261 - kyIs617 [gcy-28d::HisCl1::SL2::GFP (5 ng/l), myo-3::mCherry (5 ng/l)] 

this strain expresses HisCl1 in AIA neurons (and potentially in bunch of others as well)

Name: str-3::HisCl1::SL2::GFP
Description:
CX15954 kyEx5402 [str-3::HisCl1::SL2::GFP (100 ng/l)]

this line expresses HisCl1 in ASI neurons

Has AVA, AVE, AIB, weak AIA and other neurons.
